pullrequest.title: add qt to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH on brew in generic script instead of gazebo script

content.raw:
It is easy to build a homebrew formula from default manually by passing the `--HEAD` argument at the command line if the formula has a head repository defined (as [ignition-common does](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-common.rb#L9)). It's not possible, though, to depend on the `--HEAD` version of a formula and expect it to be installed that way.

The alternative is to periodically update the snapshot of `ignition-common` with a more recent commit from the default branch and build new bottles. It's more like a nightly or pre-release build than an official release.

Does that make sense?
